resources.string: The Home screen will display recommended new albums. Each of them will be implemented as Cards, containing a picture related to the content, the author and the album name. All of these contents come from Spotify Web API. By selecting an album, the user will be navigated to the Album Details screen. Another function on the Home screen, that the user can navigate directly to the My Favourites screen. Explicit intents are used to navigate between activities.

The Album Details screen will display detailed information about the selected album, such as album cover picture, album and author name, and the song list. These contents come by using Spotify Web API. The songs\' list will be implemented as java ArrayList. The user has the following options on this screen: Saving the whole album or an individual song to their favourites, play the whole album or only one song, or go back to the Home screen to discover other albums. Navigation to the other activities are using explicit intents.

The My Favourites screen will display the albums and the individual songs saved by the user. There will be 2 categories: one for the albums and one for the songs. Both of the categories will be displayed in a HorizontalScrollView with a horizontal LinearLayout child. The albums and songs will be stored in ArrayLists. Spotify Web API will be responsible for handling the saved content. The user can play an album/song by tapping on its name, and then will be navigated to the Now Playing screen using explicit intent. Also, they can go back to the Home screen by tapping on the Home TextView.

The Now Playing activity is responsible for the actual media player functionality. By using the MediaPlayer class, all of the required functions, like play/stop/pause/next song, etc will be available for the user. From this screen the user can navigate to the My Favourites activity or the Home activity to choose an other album/song, by using explicit intents.
